intro: Stigmaphyllon martianum, commonly known as Martian thorn, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
